content.label: This game still holds up pretty well and at this point there isn’t much to talk about since everything there is to be said has already been said. What’s important here are the controls for this mobile port. While touch screens are the bane of mobile platforming this game does its best to accommodate for the lack of buttons and provides shorts, but even a season veteran, such as myself, has a hard time adjusting to these controls. I find some of the early bosses to be difficult because of the touch screen controls and the real difficulty of this port comes from battling the controls themselves. Thank goodness this port has controller support or else I would be giving this review of the game three stars instead of four. And if someone at Konami is reading this please port this game over to PC and Switch. A lot of fans, including myself, would love to see this game on other systems.

Obviously this is an amazing game, but where is the option for the old voice actors? It’s almost purely a nostalgia trip for me but the older dialogue was much more dramatic and interesting, alucard and Dracula’s older voice actors were straight up better in my opinion.
Great game but not playable because of the controls. Please fix!
Great quality of life changes for mobile including improved controls for touch screen, now bring it to steam !
The game over screen is too long (over ten seconds) unacceptable in this modern times. At least make screen SKIPPABLE. It ruins the game experience.
I hate to see game don’t used full screen 12 pro max. Wallpaper to cover the missing place of the screen. Missing save files to cloud, I have to start over when I accidentally delete the app.

Love this game. One of the greatest games of all time, IMO. The controls are somewhat wonky, but definitely playable. My biggest gripe about this port is the new game + mode. Either we don’t have it, or I just can’t access it. The new game + is what’s so fantastic about the game after you’ve beaten it. Although not integral to the story, it is to the game. I’m rather saddened that it doesn’t seem to be included and hope that in the near future it will be.
Favorite game ever, glad to have it on my phone....it’s the little thing things

I love this game with a passion i have still on my PlayStation, I bought it for Xbox but sadly the controls for this are so poor if you don’t have a controller it’s almost impossible , if they fix the tap controls I’ll give 5 stars

SotN obviously plays way better w an actual controller, but this is a solid mobile port. I never thought this game would get an iOS port, so I’m pleasantly surprised w how well it plays. There are frustrations that happen bc a touch screen can’t replicate the experience of a controller, but for $2.99, you can’t beat it. Also, you can sub a controller up and play it that way.
It’s great to see this on iOS, and it plays well, but please add iCloud sync! I’d love to be able to pick it up and play my same save on iPad!

I didn’t even know this existed on the phone until I decided to search! I loved this game when it released! Only have gotten to the first save spot and already see differences and some recommendations.
1. The voices are different especially Alucard’s. It’s like it’s a younger person. And he no longer says “what?” When his stuff is taken away. Was expecting it and didn’t happen!
2. There is now a narrator at the opening scroll.
3. Was expecting graphics to be a bit more polished. I like the original look but it’s not the same menus and being middle aged now, it’s hard to read such tiny print.
4. The map is tiny! This game relies heavily on getting 100% map completion. Can barely see a doorway! There is no zoom and would rectify a lot if you can zoom the map. Activating the map with the right thumb stick on the controller is super weird and very finicky to stop viewing it.

I really hope the ending sone hasn’t been touch. It’s a great song! Time to delve into nostalgia with SOTN!

So this is one of my favorite games of all time. To be able to play it on my iphone/iPad was a must have. But..... the controls are absolutely terrible and I couldn’t enjoy the game at all. The spells are annoying to preform and the button placement is beyond frustrating. All this from the immediate start of the game. I would imagine a Bluetooth controller may be a solution. But, I am not a fan of bringing bulky items around on the subway or to a park.

Look, I've been a fan of this game since it's release on the PS1. I've owned this title for just about every console it's been re-released on, so needless to say I had to have this! However, the dev failed to improve upon what emulaters have been doing for years now...UPSCALE! Use better filters! And why no wide screen rendering? Very disappointed about this. The game lacks the vibrancy it deserves. Hopefully a future update will correct these issues.

I’ve been itching to play this game ever since I got into Aria of Sorrow, and this port of the original Symphony of the Night is amazing!
I will say that the touch controls do seem (like many other games with touch controls) difficult. They work, but they aren’t comfortable. Playing with a controller though eliminates that problem.
The one problem I DO have with using wireless controllers for this game is that the button to open your map is set to UP on the right joystick. The controller that I use doesn’t have joysticks (it’s just a d-pad, L/R, Start/Select, and the A/B/Y/X buttons), so it becomes annoying having to disconnect my controller to open the map from the touchscreen and then reconnect it to play comfortably.
The select button doesn’t even do anything in this port, and I know that in previous Castlevania titles the select button served the sole purpose of opening the map. If Konami could fix that and remap the map button to select, then this game would be flawless (when used with a controller).
I was hooked the second I started playing it. The game starts off at a sprint and doesn't stop. The game is fun and incredibly interesting. I would recommend to everybody
10/10 amazing game but for the love of everything you hold dear, play it on a real controller.
Please add saturn mode. sega saturn is not comeback again... Please add saturn plus mode...

🤘 Hopefully they’re all going to be released. Don’t even think about it - GIVE THEM YOUR MONEY! Support games like this.
Now that that’s aside. Castlevania is one of the greatest platform games ever EVER, PERIOD. Sorry for the caps, just excited, please release the rest 😛
Great game haven’t played this in a while , it works perfectly with my MFI controller
I played this game to the ground when it first came out. I couldn't play for more than 15 minutes before giving up. Could someone fix these unresponsive controls.

I just wanna say I love this game. It’s long and tedious but that’s what I like about it. You won’t get bored quickly. What I came here to write about tho is the controls-
They’re just horrible. When you try to do a gravity jump in the game you can’t do it in rapid succession. The buttons NEED TO BE BIGGER!!! Please Konami make the buttons bigger?!?!?!

title.label: Still waiting on a true remaster...

content.label:
This is more or less the exact same game that released on the PSOne in the 90s. That's not a bad thing as SOTN is hands down one of the greatest games ever made. That being said it hasn’t aged particularly well. The game has always had some balancing issues. Depending on how you tackle it, Alucard can become godlike pretty early on and never really gets challenged. Especially once you know the boss patterns, many can be cheesed way too simply. More challenging boss battles and an adaptive enemy leveling system (hunting down the most powerful times in the game would be a lot more rewarding if you knew there where still enemies that could challenge you to use them on) would go a long way to freshen this game up. Along with some new items, areas, enemies, and updated graphics. Still, until (if ever) we get a true remaster, this is still the best Castlevania out there and having it with me at all times is pretty great. I never get tired of playing through it. All time great gameplay and the best soundtrack of all time.

Two last things...

Controls are merely adequate, and while not awful I’d definitely recommend a controller. Some fights really require precise timing and touch screen controls just make it annoying.

Why on earth replace the original classically bad voice acting with updated but still just as bad voice acting!? Get good voice actors or lean into the cheese and keep the originals.

I absolutely love this game. It takes a while to get used to the controls, but once you do, it’s fantastic. It’s gotta be one if the best mobile versions of a retro game ever. I’m dying for Konami to release Aria of Sorrow to play that too.

This is an excellent re-release for IOS and is long overdue. For everyone complaining about the controls switch to a Bluetooth controller and quit whining. This game is a perfect package and is a GREAT value at its price point. Not having Apple TV support is my one and only gripe.

Its a garbage!
Absolutely unresponsive controls! When you press hit it doesnt hit! 
You cant change controls size! And cant hit that small buttons! So you will hate the game after 5 minutes.

Also a horrible cut scene when you die that lusts for decade and you cant skip it!!!

Dont waste your money. This trash doesnt worth it.
It’s an awesome port but many flaws in game with controls, can’t even dash with iPhone controller

Controls are too far apart for each button on the iPad. Enjoy dying constantly because you missed the whip button or the D pad. Game just kind of jumped into the castle immediately and it seems like the story is gone? Haven’t played this game in over a decade and have no idea what is going on.
The lousy/touchy controls (with and without a controller) make moving around frustrating.  Gave up after I died for the millionth time.  The unskippable laughter did it for me...

How do you even screw up this hard. Was this tested? This game would not only be better but so much more fun if they changed the controls. The controls are just way too precise to make this game enjoyable for me. I have long skinny fingers and I am playing on the iPhone 11 Pro Max and STILL the button placement is too small and unadaptive. The precision during combat and/or aiming is just a nightmare making everything so much more stressful than it should. I have to put so much focus on the controls and no matter how much I’ve tried...it just doesn’t work out for me. I have to pay more attention to the controls than actually fighting or moving around with ease and that’s just not fun, dude. Fix this.

title.label: The worst port I’ve ever played.

content.label:
The best Castlevania of all time is back in the worst port on the planet. 

There is a section in the library where you have to jump and mist through a grate to get a power that is necessary if you want to experience this game to its full potential. This task took fifteen minutes to accomplish with these controls, and was only doable after utilizing four fingers. That’s only the start of the control problems. When and if you even can reach the inverted castle, the game becomes nearly, and in my opinion completely unplayable due to the tiny, non-customizable control scheme.

This port is a straight up dumpster fire, suiting for the company Konami has become. There is absolutely no way this game was play tested, or maybe it was and that’s why it’s $3. Just learn to use an emulator and find an iso, because this port isn’t even worth three bucks. 

Anyone giving this review 5 stars is basing it off of their past experience, because this sure as hell is not a good experience. Taking the money you’d spend on this game and buying a box of tacks to step on would be a more enjoyable experience. 

Just let this company die before they ruin even more classics.
The game keeps slowing down. Just got through 70% of first castle and completely locked up in the library save area. The game will not even load from the save screen now.

I loved this game 20 years ago, and it’s just as fun now. 

I don’t play many phone games, so the controls are a little frustrating, as I miss the buttons frequently in intense situations.

Otherwise, it’s an awesome port and well worth the 3$. Now let’s get Dawn and Aria ported!! Let’s go Konami!
So hard to play as Maria and Richter but the gameplay is so worth the money and time spent trying to clear the map. Best game on the IOS store right now hands down.

I was having fun with the game until the controls ruined it for me. There are times when hitting the attack buttons not registering with the character, which has led to many annoying deaths during boss battles.  There’s also no button mapping or resizing.

The original voice acting sucked and they didn’t just change it. They changed the voice acting when they ported it to the psp so that’s nothing new. The new touch screen menus are great. I’d recommend playing it on a bigger model of I phone. I can see why you would have trouble playing it on a smaller model. Personally I see no flaws with this port and if you are new to the game I highly recommend down loading this. It’s a great port and a great game. Konami finally did something right. They have really let me down over the years and I hope this is a sign of change. 

Side note. The ps1 version was a bad port anyway and was unfinished.
Great game, definitely worth the money. Pretty hard to play on iPhone so having to sit through the long game over sequence is very annoying after the 30th time

Buy this immediately. Good gracious. It’s just as good as I remember.

Sounds like they changed some voice actors.

The controls are... not awesome. Maybe buy a handheld controller?
One of my favorite games from the PS.  Was super excited to play it again, but the unresponsive controls make the game unplayable.

Clock room won’t open up the left side after sitting in there for a min also don’t hear ticking from the big clock either but you need to. To get to the next area. Please fix besides that i really missed this game good job sure has some good memories.

Wow! I am just pleased with this, I am 28 and I grew up playing castlevania and I am so happy to be playing this, yeah there are some voice ins. But I am still very happy to play this. It makes me want to get a PlayStation 1 again. So much good memories whoever made this thank you from the bottom of my heart, and making it mobile. This game of castlevaina will always be my all time favorite PS1 game.  Thank you so Much!!!

Miss game since the original on every format and this gameplay is absolutely the worst. It’s horrible. If your finger is an exactly on the control it doesn’t work and half the time it doesn’t work anyway. Please fix this it’s such a shame on a great game.
People who don’t play this game probably just hate fun. It’s good classic 2D fun. Works great with a controller! Game developers TAKE NOTE put more of your classic games on mobile!
The game is simply fun and with xbox controller the inputlag is minimal and artwork is stunning.

My first problem is that when you get to the marble gallery and you expect to hear the marble gallery theme. It instead plays the outer wall theme. The biggest part of the game for me was the music and how it made every area of the game feel different. If it’s just going to play that same song through the entire castle, then I can’t play it. If anyone remembers the PlayStation version of the game. You could put the disc into a CD player and access all of the tracks. The track listing of the game is would made this game what it was. I’m afraid all of the music is not in the game and it’s stopping me from moving forward.

title.label: Glad I can play with the controller

content.label: The game is just as great as I remember. I think the only updating needs is to add a Map button on the controller. Other wise it’s perfect.
the game is incomplete! after Richter Belmont boss there should be a continuation of the game and the map, but reset to “continue”
Can anybody tell me how to double jump, I am stuck in an area and can only get out by double jumping.

Absolutely love this game! No need for WiFi so you can play it anywhere. I have no complaints the game runs smoothly. So many things I didn’t know about the game until now. There’s so much to do in the game, definitely hard to put it down once you start! 😁
They really need to make the movement pad smaller.  On a phone or a tablet a large game pad doesn’t work well.  Please fix this and the game will be just as enjoyable as the consoles.
